reviewText: Joel McCrea still doesn't receive the credit he is due as an actor. BORDER RIVER is one of his better Westerns, with solid direction, good acting, and a good plot. The VHS copy is fine, and let's hope it will find its way onto DVD.
summary: One of Joel McCrea's better pics

reviewText: This may be a typical Joel McCrea western, but it's a good one. Plenty of action and the beautiful Yvonne DeCarlo to decorate the scenes. I love the good old westerns of the 1950's. They're not all classics, but they're fun to add to your collection.

reviewText: Universal International Pictures presents "BORDER RIVER" (1954) (80 min/Color) -- Starring Joel McCrea, Yvonne De Carlo, Pedro Armendáriz, Howard Petrie, Ivan Triesault & Erika NordinDirected by George ShermanWith the South facing defeat, idealistic Confederate Major Clete Mattson (Joel McCrea) desperately tries to save his army by stealing $2,000,000 in Union gold. He then heads to a raucous border town of Zona Libre, a small enclave on the Rio Grande, hoping to make a munitions deal with Mexican general Calleja (Pedro Armendariz). But first, Mattson must contend with Calleja's double-crossing German military adviser Baron Von Holden (Ivan Triesault), not to mention Calleja's tempestuous sweetheart Carmelita (Yvonne De Carlo), who is also not to be trusted.Special footnote: -- Another solid performance by Joel McCrea, plus Yvonne De Carlo and Pedro Armendáriz give strength in their performances in this rare film, portraying a turbulent time in our history and just how dedicated some members of the confederacy were in prolonging the war.BIOS:1. George Sherman [Director]Date of Birth: 14 July 1908 - New YorkDate of Death: 15 March 1991 - Los Angeles County, California2. Joel McCreaDate of Birth: 5 November 1905 - South Pasadena, CaliforniaDate of Death: 20 October 1990 - Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California3. Yvonne De Carlo [aka: Margaret Yvonne Middleton]Date of Birth: 1 September 1922 - Vancouver, British Columbia, CanadaDate of Death: 8 January 2007 - Woodland Hills, California4. Pedro Armendáriz [aka: Pedro Gregorio Armendáriz Hastings]Date of Birth: 9 May 1912 - Mexico City, Distrito Federal, MexicoDate of Death: 18 June 1963 - Los Angeles, CaliforniaMr. Jim's Ratings:Quality of Picture & Sound: 4 StarsPerformance: 5 StarsStory & Screenplay: 4 StarsOverall: 4 Stars [Original Music, Cinematography & Film Editing]Total Time: 80 min on VHS/DVD ~ Universal International Pictures ~ (May 21, 2009)

reviewText: Border River is a fine little western with great acting and action though typical for many Joel McCrea westerns it would have been nice with a little more action. Yvonne De Carlo is beautiful, the picture is crisp like being in the theater. Pedro Amandariz is a fine slimy mexican officer and he has the line of the year: We give them a fair trial and shoot them tomorrow morning!
